definition: to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash

sentences.english: He felt a dull throbbing pain in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他感到腦袋隱隱地抽痛。

sentences.english: His head wound throbbed with pain.
sentences.chinese: 他頭上的傷口一陣陣抽痛。

sentences.english: This cut Hurstwood like a whip, and made him sullen.
sentences.chinese: 這話像鞭子一樣抽痛了赫斯渥。

sentences.english: Her right arm throbbed from the infected cut.
sentences.chinese: 她的右臂因傷口感染而陣陣抽痛。

sentences.english: The back of my head throbbed, as usual, when I remembered that money.
sentences.chinese: 我的後腦勺一如往常我想到那些錢般抽痛。

definition: to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
sharp pain/cramp/griping pain/colic/angina, cf 心絞痛|心绞痛
to sneak in/to infiltrate/to be piercingly painful/to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
pit of the stomach/solar plexus/words and thoughts
